amendment.description: To provide a sense of Congress that computer science education programs, including coding academics, can provide important benefits to local industries and the economy and help meet in-demand workforce needs, and the Department of Education and Department of Labor should work together with industry to improve and expand computer science education programs and opportunities, including through apprenticeships.

vote.text: Amendment SA 3883 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 3883 proposed by Senator McConnell for Senator Wicker to Amendment SA 3695. (consideration: CR S5903; text: CR S5903) To provide a sense of Congress that computer science education programs, including coding academics, can provide important benefits to local industries and the economy and help meet in-demand workforce needs, and the Department of Education and Department of Labor should work together with industry to improve and expand computer science education programs and opportunities, including through apprenticeships.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 3883 proposed by Senator McConnell for Senator Wicker to Amendment SA 3695.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 3883 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
